title: Perfect Price Discrimination with Constant MC

content.question: Price <math alttext="open parenthesis, in dollars, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> Quantity Demanded <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> <math alttext="9" overflow="scroll"><mn>9</mn></math> <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> <math alttext="8" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn></math> <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> <math alttext="7" overflow="scroll"><mn>7</mn></math> <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math> <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn></math> <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> <math alttext="5" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn></math> <math alttext="6" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn></math> <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math> <math alttext="7" overflow="scroll"><mn>7</mn></math> <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> <math alttext="8" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn></math> <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> <math alttext="9" overflow="scroll"><mn>9</mn></math> <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> A profit-maximizing monopolist faces the market demand schedule provided and has a constant marginal cost of <math alttext="$5" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">$</mi><mn>5</mn></math>. If the monopolist engages in perfect price discrimination, its total revenue will equal which of the following?

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Interpret a specific economic outcome using quantitative data or calculations.
